events.body:
ACK e3f1da4bf3db120cc691a844d612fbc522f11fb9

I performed my own backport here: https://github.com/jarolrod/bitcoin/tree/pr22427-check
My backport and this PR are a zero-diff. Tested on Linux, macOS, and Windows.

**Notes on Backport Commits:**

- Cherry picking [7f3a5980c1d54988a707b961fd2ef647cebb4c5b](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/7f3a5980c1d54988a707b961fd2ef647cebb4c5b) on top of 0.21 does not involve any conflicts. Easy to verify that the cherry pick is correct because we are only making changes inside of the `setClipboard` function
- Cherry picking [9ea1da6fc91e17bdaa722001b97aadf576f07f65](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commit/9ea1da6fc91e17bdaa722001b97aadf576f07f65) also involves no conflict and commit is properly cherry-picked.
- Cherry picking [cd46c11577a05f3dc9eac94f27a6985f6ba0509e](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commit/cd46c11577a05f3dc9eac94f27a6985f6ba0509e) involves a conflict with placement and with `0.21` not having [97a6b5e06a532a4ee029c8ba59c3438369f8b049](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/97a6b5e06a532a4ee029c8ba59c3438369f8b049). The conflict is properly resolved and the commit is properly cherry-picked

**Testing Notes:**

- [#277](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/277) Backport Functionality
  - *Background:* [#277](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/277) was made to fix issue [#258](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/issues/258). The issue outlined that copying something to the clipboard would result in the log getting filled with the following: `GUI: Data set on unsupported clipboard mode. QMimeData object will be deleted.`. [#277](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/277) fixed this by applying the following note from the Qt docs: [QClipboard - Note for Windows and macOS USers](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qclipboard.html#notes-for-windows-and-macos-users). 

  - *Testing:* I have confirmed that the backport maintains the intended functionality by checking that there are no log entries for this warning on `Windows` and `macOS`. The log entries are comfirmed to be there when building of the current `0.21` branch.

- [#365](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/365) Backport Functionality
  - *Background:* [#365](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/365) improved UI for watch only transactions by drawing it at the beginning of a watch-only address on the overview page. Additionally, this PR fixed issue [#373](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/issues/373). The issue showed how the GUI page would expand to the size of the list of addresses involved with a recent transaction shown on the overview page. The GUI window could then not be resized to be smaller. [#365](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/365) fixed this issue by no longer bounding to `address_rect_min_width`. We were bounding to this width in order to show the watch only icon which was previously shown at the end of the address list. Now that it is being shown at the start of the address list, we don't need to bound to this.

  - *Testing:* I have confirmed that the backport maintains the intended functionality by following th same testing procedure as I did here: https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/365#pullrequestreview-685895788
